data.title: January 12th, 2012 Snowfall Event Summary
data.text:
Snowfall Map | Snowfall Amounts | A Late First Snow Storm

For a Water Vapor Loop from January 12th, click here (~3 MB).

Snowfall Map

Click Map to Enlarge

Snowfall Map From Northwest Illinois & Eastern Iowa

An experimental snowfall analysis page can be found here [updated continually]

Snowfall Amounts

Below are the preliminary snowfall totals from CoCoRaHS and the NWS's COOP Network.

A text listing of all of the Local Storm Reports (LSR) can be found further down.

Late First Appreciable Snowfall

PUBLIC INFORMATION STATEMENT NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE CHICAGO IL 227 AM CST FRI JAN 13 2012 /327 AM EST FRI JAN 13 2012/ ...A LATE SEASON FIRST APPRECIABLE SNOWFALL... THIS WINTER SEASON HAD A REMARKABLY SLOW START TO IT THROUGH THE FIRST WEEK AND A HALF OF JANUARY...WITH BOTH LITTLE SNOW AND MILD TEMPERATURES. THERE HAD YET TO BE A SINGLE TWO INCH SNOW EVENT IN EITHER CHICAGO OR ROCKFORD THROUGH THAT TIME. AFTER ONE FINAL VERY MILD DAY IN THE 50S ON JANUARY 11TH...TEMPERATURES PLUNGED AND SNOW OVERSPREAD THE AREA ON JANUARY 12TH. WIDESPREAD SNOWFALL AMOUNTS OF 4 TO 7 INCHES WERE SEEN ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE CALENDAR DAY OF THE 12TH. THE FOLLOWING STATISTICS ATTEMPT TO PUT INTO PERSPECTIVE HOW LATE OF A START THIS WAS FOR A FIRST APPRECIABLE EVENT. .CHICAGO... 4.7 INCHES OF SNOW WAS OFFICIALLY MEASURED AT CHICAGO O`HARE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT ON JANUARY 12TH. FOR THE 2011-2012 WINTER SEASON...THIS WAS THE FIRST EVENT THAT PRODUCED AT LEAST TWO INCHES OF SNOWFALL. THROUGH THE PAST ONE HUNDRED YEARS...THE AVERAGE DAY WITH TWO INCHES OF SNOW AT CHICAGO IS DECEMBER 16TH. IN THAT TIME...THERE HAVE ONLY BEEN ELEVEN WINTERS TO SEE A FIRST TWO INCH PLUS SNOW IN A DAY LATER THAN THE 2011-2012 WINTER. THERE HAVE ONLY BEEN FOUR WINTERS SINCE 1940 /RETURN FREQUENCY OF ONCE EVERY 18 YEARS/. THIS LATE OF A FIRST TWO INCH SNOWFALL HAD NOT BEEN SEEN SINCE THE 2001-2002 WINTER...WHEN THE FIRST TWO INCH PLUS EVENT MATERIALIZED ON JANUARY 16TH 2002. THE LATEST IN THE PAST ONE HUNDRED YEARS WAS DURING THE 1930-1931 WINTER...WHEN THE FIRST TWO PLUS INCH EVENT DID NOT OCCUR UNTIL MARCH 7 1931. .ROCKFORD... THE JANUARY 12TH CALENDAR DAY BROUGHT 4.5 INCHES OF SNOW OFFICIALLY AT ROCKFORD. THIS WAS THE FIRST EVENT WITH AT LEAST TWO INCHES OF SNOWFALL THIS SEASON. LOOKING BACK SINCE 1940..THE AVERAGE FIRST CALENDAR DAY WITH TWO INCHES OF SNOW IN ROCKFORD DURING A WINTER SEASON IS DECEMBER 7TH. IN THOSE PAST 71 YEARS...THERE HAVE ONLY BEEN THREE WINTERS TO SEE A FIRST TWO INCH PLUS SNOW IN A DAY LATER THAN THE 2011-2012 WINTER /RETURN FREQUENCY OF ONCE EVERY 24 YEARS/. THIS LATE OF A FIRST TWO INCH SNOWFALL HAD NOT BEEN SEEN SINCE THE 2001-2002 WINTER...WHEN THE FIRST TWO INCH PLUS EVENT MATERIALIZED ON JANUARY 16TH 2002. THE LATEST SINCE 1940 WAS DURING THE 1980-1981 WINTER...WHEN THE FIRST TWO INCH PLUS EVENT DID NOT OCCUR UNTIL FEBRUARY 10 1981. $$
